message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.CL. 

The paper deals with the task of human parsing, which involves segmenting an image into different parts of the human body. This task falls under computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper proposes a neural information fusion framework, which involves combining information from different sources, such as direct inference, bottom-up inference, and top-down inference. This approach involves modeling the compositional and decompositional relations in human bodies, which falls under the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and multimedia (cs.MM). Finally, the paper also discusses the use of confidence estimation for multi-source information fusion, which falls under the sub-category of natural language processing (cs.CL).
